trans-unit.source: Pure Python, cross platform, single function module with no dependencies for playing sounds.
trans-unit.target: Pure Python, cross platform, single function module with no dependencies for playing sounds.

trans-unit.source: Copyright
trans-unit.target: Derechos de autor

trans-unit.source: Documentation
trans-unit.target: Documentación

trans-unit.source: Done.
trans-unit.target: Hecho.

trans-unit.source: I’ve only tested playsound it with Python 2.7 on Windows 7 and OS X 10.11, but I expect that it should work on Windows XP thru 10 at least, OS X 10.5 and newer, all versions of Linux, and Python 2.3 and newer.
trans-unit.target: I’ve only tested playsound it with Python 2.7 on Windows 7 and OS X 10.11, but I expect that it should work on Windows XP thru 10 at least, OS X 10.5 and newer, all versions of Linux, and Python 2.3 and newer.

trans-unit.source: If you insist on the (slightly) harder way of installing, from source, you know how to do it already and don’t need my help.
trans-unit.target: If you insist on the (slightly) harder way of installing, from source, you know how to do it already and don’t need my help.

trans-unit.source: Install via pip:
trans-unit.target: Instalar a través de la tubería:

trans-unit.source: Installation
trans-unit.target: Instalación

trans-unit.source: It requires one argument - the path to the file with the sound you’d like to play. This may be a local file, or a URL.
trans-unit.target: It requires one argument - the path to the file with the sound you’d like to play. This may be a local file, or a URL.

trans-unit.source: On Linux, uses GStreamer. Known to work on Ubuntu 14.04 and ElementaryOS Loki. Support for the
trans-unit.target: En Linux,usa GStreamer.Se sabe que funciona en Ubuntu 14.04 y ElementaryOS Loki.El soporte para el

trans-unit.source: On OS X, uses AppKit.NSSound. WAVE and MP3 have been tested and are known to work. In general, anything QuickTime can play, playsound should be able to play, for OS X.
trans-unit.target: En OS X,usa AppKit.NSSound.WAVE y MP3 han sido probados y se sabe que funcionan.En general,cualquier cosa que QuickTime pueda reproducir,playsound debería poder reproducirse,para OS X.

trans-unit.source: On Windows, uses windll.winmm. WAVE and MP3 have been tested and are known to work. Other file formats may work as well.
trans-unit.target: En Windows,usa windll.winmm.WAVE y MP3 han sido probados y se sabe que funcionan.Otros formatos de archivo pueden funcionar también.

trans-unit.source: Once you’ve installed, you can really quickly verified that it works with just this:
trans-unit.target: Once you’ve installed, you can really quickly verified that it works with just this:

trans-unit.source: Pure Python, cross platform, single function module with no dependencies for playing sounds.
trans-unit.target: Python puro,plataforma cruzada,módulo de una sola función sin dependencias para la reproducción de sonidos.

trans-unit.target: Inicio rápido

trans-unit.target: Requisitos

trans-unit.source: See the bundled LICENSE file for more information.
trans-unit.target: Vea el archivo de la LICENCIA para más información.

trans-unit.source: The latest version of the source code can be found at: https://github.com/TaylorSMarks/playsound
trans-unit.target: The latest version of the source code can be found at: https://github.com/TaylorSMarks/playsound

trans-unit.source: The playsound module contains only one thing - the function (also named) playsound.
trans-unit.target: El módulo de playsound contiene sólo una cosa-la función (también llamada)playsound.

trans-unit.source: There’s an optional second argument, block, which is set to True by default. Setting it to False makes the function run asynchronously.
trans-unit.target: There’s an optional second argument, block, which is set to True by default. Setting it to False makes the function run asynchronously.
